results.title: Give & take = Give and take
results.brief_description: Consumer and Corporate Affairs Canada is a federal government agency concerned with protecting the interests of the consumer in today’s complex and highly competitive marketplace. Whatever is sold commercially —eggs, home furnishings, construction helmets, heating and cooking fuels — comes under its scrutiny. This film describes the whole range of checks and investigations carried out by the Department.

results.title: Giv'em a half turn
results.creator_credit: Reevan Dolgoy, Jerry Krepakevich and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Russ Yuristy, the funky sculptor from Silton, Saskatchewan, has just finished a wooden buffalo commissioned by the city councillors of Swift Current. This film is about Yuristy’s three-ton buffalo, its 240-kilometer trip from studio to park, and the comments of the bystanders who react to the buffalo’s unusual looks. This light-hearted film shows one of the Prairies’ most unusual artists.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reevan Dolgoy, Jerry Krepakevich and ONF | NFB

results.title: Giselle
results.creator_credit: Maxim Krastin, Preben Montell, Oleg Vinogradov, Gosteleradio and National Video Corporation (International)
results.brief_description: This presentation of Giselle is performed by The Kirov Ballet at the Leningrad Theatre of Opera and Ballet. A romantic ballet in two acts featuring Galina Mezentseva (Giselle), Konstantin Zaklinsky (Albrecht), Gennadi Selyutski (Hilarion), Tatyana Terekhova (Myrtha) and Olga Vtorishina and Sergei Vuharev dancing the Pas de Deux in Act one with choreography by Jean Coralli and Jules Perrot, revised by Marius Petipa, and the Orchestra of the Leningrad Theatre of Opera and Ballet conducted by Viktor Fedotov. A beautifully staged ballet in soft pastels and fairy-tale atmosphere. Made for television.

results.title: Giselle
results.creator_credit: Rudolf Nureyev, Stanley Dorfman and Associated Television
results.brief_description: This made for television production of the classical ballet Giselle about love and betrayal stars Rudolf Nureyev as Count Albrect and Lynn Seymour as Giselle, with Monica Mason (Myrtha), Youri Vamos (Hilarion) and members of The Ballet of the Bavarian State Opera House. Original choreography by Jules Perrot and Jean Coralli, music by Adolphe Adam performed by The New World Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted and directed by David Coleman.

results.title: Giselle
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Maina Gielgud and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: The story of Giselle is a romantic tale of innocent love and betrayal, of Prince Albrecht and a trusting peasant maid, Giselle. This beautiful production of this classic ballet is directed by Maina Gielgud, Artistic Director of the Australian Ballet.

results.title: Girl stuff
results.creator_credit: Barbara Noble, Robert Churchill and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Aimed at adolescent girls this program covers a range of issues regarding female hygiene. Discusses the pros and cons of deodorants, advice about pelvic infections and changes in the reproductive system at puberty.

results.title: Girl guides parade at Windsor Castle (19/6/1938)
results.brief_description: On June 19, 1938 a thousand Guides from all over the country marched past their majesties the King and Queen in the quadrangle of Windsor Castle. Her Majesty is patroness of the Association. Silent film - no credits or title available.

results.title: Giraffe
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the simple daily patterns of the giraffe at home in Tanzania. Examines through close ups its unusual shape and size: its markings, height and long legs.

results.title: Gippsland: Through the forest
results.brief_description: Provides a look at the life forms of the Gippsland forest area. Here the world’s tallest hardwood tree, the mountain ash, towers to a height of one hundred metres or more and provides food and shelter at all levels, from the forest floor where the lyrebird scavengers to the tree tops which provide launching pads for the spectacular sugar gliders. Shows also the impact of the area’s two enemies: fire and man, and shows a rare glimpse of the family life of Australia’s laughing bird, the kookaburra.

results.title: Gippsland: the high country
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, ABC-TV (Australia) and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: Part of “The World we share” series. Provides an exploration of the mountains in Gippsland through the changing seasons. Shows how the long winter surprisingly sustains a complex network of life underneath the snow. The brief spring and summer bring a rush of life witnessed in the vocal battle of frogs over territory, the birth of a butterfly, the migration of cockatoos and the life style of the burramy. Suitable for upper secondary level.
